attention1.ptxt: To help avoid danger of being burned, do not remove degassing tank cap while engine and radiator are still hot. Scalding fluid and steam can be blown out under pressure if cap is taken off too soon.

attention3.ptxt: For detail of coolant specification, refer to Coolant Description:F9Q .

s1.ptxt: Remove air ventilation plug (2) from thermostat assembly (3).
Fill degassing tank with coolant until coolant flow out from air ventilation plug, and then tighten air ventilation plug.
Fill degassing tank with coolant up to “MAXI” level mark (4).
Run engine as follows in order to bleed air remained in engine and radiator.

s2.ptxt: Run engine at 1500 r/min until upper radiator hose is hot.
Run engine at 2000 r/min for 20 minutes.

attention3.ptxt: If coolant level comes lower than “MINI” level mark (5) during this step, perform the following procedures.

item.ptxt: Stop engine and wait until engine is cooled.
Fill degassing tank with coolant up to “MAXI” level mark.

s1.ptxt: Stop engine and wait until engine is cooled.
Fill degassing tank with coolant up to “MAXI” level mark.
